html: (2 Nephi 8:2)."I called him alone, and blessed him, and increased him." Because of his great righteousness, the Lord promised Abraham that He would bless him and his posterity, making of them "a great nation." (Genesis 12:1-3.) "In thy seed," he was told, "shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed." (3 Nephi 20:27; see also Galatians 3:8.) Through the ministry of Abraham the Lord's name would "be known in the earth forever." (Abraham 1:19.) Indeed, all who accept the gospel of Jesus Christ will be accounted as "Abraham's seed" (Galatians 3:26-29), which would be as numerous as the stars (Genesis 15:5).
